channel.title: Portfolios on Masaki Iwabuchi.web
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on Masaki Iwabuchi.web

item.title: Fictional Real, Real Fiction
Photography 100 years after
item.description:
This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Children is playing in a "virtual forest".
Are these images our future dreamed life?

This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. I reviewed my lifemoment archives and found my external memory failed to save one second of my life.
What will be the difference between our ''memories’’ and ''records‘‘?

This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Most of the time we spend in a virtual world and we begin not to rely on our physical existences.
Can we discard our physical sense completely?

This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Today is the Super moon for the first time in 100 years!
How many things will remain after 100 years?

This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Finally, new media displaced photography and this is the final day of photography. I decided to shoot my robotic wife.
What do you want to shoot in your last moment?

Exhibited in Art Photograph Group Show Part. 27, RECTO VERSO GALLERY, Tokyo, Japan, Feb 2016

item.title: IBM Studio Board
item.description:
We respect traditional IBM design philosophy.

And also we reflect and show new IBM design environment and culture.

I mixed these two tides and continued prototyping with senior designers, and finally delivered the entrance board.

I reflected atmosphere of studio, such as colorful chair and posting sticky notes culture.

item.title: Uber
item.description:
concept: A driver and a rider can meet 100% accuracy without inconvenience using a translating function.

Design Process

Learn Methodology

Stakeholder Interview and Business Goal Setting

User Research: Using AEIOU Worksheet invented by IDEO, we actually used Uber at the JFK airport and observe interactions as a rider.

Analysing Insights and Problem Defining

Solution Design

Customer Journey and Final Presentation

item.title: AM3:00, Lower East Side
item.description: Exhibited in New City Art Fair (in EINSTEIN STUDIO booth), hpgrp Gallery, New York, USA, Mar 2016

item.title: Parsons Summer
item.description:
Poster Design: Using only type, made a poster which explains how to do something specific. I’ve dealt with “How to Ride NYC Subway“. I’ve used subway-like iconic circles and rectlinear text to conjure up subway in NYC.

Design Focus: Typography, Shape, Positive & Negative, B&W
Design Tool: Adobe Illustrator

I’ve expressed the winding journey. The way is up and down. Time and weather always change; come and go. In some sense, it means a journey of our life.

Bookjacket Design: Designed a book jacket & matching slipcase reflecting the meaning of title of a novel. I’ve dealt with “Journey Without Maps“ by Graham Greene. I’ve imagined a long journey of letters and made a manual cut-and-paste design.

Design Focus: Typography, Shape, Positive & Negative, Unity, B&W
Design Tool: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator

Book Design: Designed 12-pages self-cover book based on Coney Island wandering. I’ve taken so many photos of Coney Island and dealt with materials I’ve found. Magenta rectangles are highlights to show each material.

Design Focus: Typography, Photography, Positive & Negative, Unity, 1-Color
Design Tool: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign

Timeline Design: Took the poster I’ve designed and added a time element using the Timeline Panel in Photoshop. I’ve designed the 70 sec movie which introduces steps to ride subway in NYC. Numbers in circles conjure up images of icons of subway in NYC.

Design Focus: Typography, Motion, Sound, Color
Design Tool:Adobe Photoshop

Application Design: Designed App and Poster which introduce 5 spots of Coney Island. I’ve dealt with 5 flowers of Coney Island. This App introduces images and locations of flowers. I’ve imagined vivid colors of flowers as a ribbon and designed screens vertically.

Design Focus: Typography, Photography, Positive & Negative, Unity, 1-Color
Design Tool: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Muse

Identity Design: Designed graphic identity for a festival event celebrating a neighborhood in NYC. I’ve dealt with Japanese Food Festival in East Village. I’ve used chopsticks as a symbol of this event and designed an envelope, invitation letter, bag, badge and small goods. To produce Japanese atomosphere, I’ve used Japanese papers and stereoscopic gimmicks like Ninja.

Design Focus: Typography, Unity, Texture, Material, Color
Design Tool: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustator

item.title: Accuracy of Deja-vu
Tokyo Christmas Collection
IBM CSC
item.description:
Concept: Victims can know what they should do by themselves when damaged and get support immediately.

Design Process

Global Data Research

Business Goal Setting

Field Observing and Staff Interview

Analize Insights and Problem Defining

Solution Design and Strategy/Roadmap Planning

Final Presentation

item.title: Rainy Day Tokyo
CompAge
item.description:
Concept: Designers can show their talents and get work in a social platform.

Design Process: I’ve taken responsibility for the entire online service design and development from infrestructure to front-end.

Design Process

Exhibited in Make − Tokyo Meeting 06, Tokyo, Japan, 2010.

item.title: LimpiDual Touch
item.description:
Concept: Users can interact from the rear side of the display without a finger occlusion problem.

Design Process

Discourse Research and Problem Finding

Ideation

Technology Research and Prototype

Development and Evaluation

item.title: Syncing Floor
item.description:
Concept: Visitors can feel the bustle of the exhibition site inconspicuously.

Design Process: I built all functions from back-end to front-end. Using infrared sensor, I extracted moments that person passed away my artwork. And then I visualized these bustles of 2 distant locations using network programming and OpenGL.

Exhibited in iii exhibition 7, Media art exhibition of The University of Tokyo, Japan, 2007.
